column4: how to switch from ubuntu to windows xp? I get an error unknown device and I used a liveCD to gpart to fat32 and ntfs. What else do i might need to do?
using the livecd?
If you want to remove Ubuntu and install XP, you just need to put in the XP cd, delete all the partitions, and make a new NTFS or FAT to install to.
Why not?
Well, then nothing you can do in GParted will fix that
Do you get to the point from the install CD that lets you set up partitions?
Then it may be the CD you're using. Is it scratched up or dirty?
Give me a minute to google that error code, and I'll see...
According to Microsoft's website, that error happens when the boot device can't be accessed... In other words, the CD can't read itself...
My guess is that it's a misconfiguration/bug in your BIOS
Well, could it be a bad burn then? Did you check the MD5 of the ISO and compare it to the MD5 of the CD?
I mean the MD5 of the CD itself, not just what the MD5 of the ISO is supposed to be (though you should check that, too).

Also, I'm going to assume that this is a legal copy that you downloaded from MSDN's student downloads or something like that, but if it happens to be an illegal copy, you may want to check your source
Have you tried it in another computer (don't install it, just boot)
Must be. New CD-ROM hardware might not work in XP
I think there is some way to install XP from a thumb drive, but I have no idea...
Or maybe you could try a USB CD-ROM drive if you have one handy
Ah, this must be the problem:  >>OerHeks: undecim, if it is a sata disk, xp won't work, ..
If you're laptop was made for Vista/7, it's probably a sata disk
check your bios for IDE Legacy mode
Or something like that... basically to make SATA drives act like IDE drives
